0418d50e-ca7f-42ed-bb25-b0d0064768fc.content:
Symptoms of a heart attack can include:


  • Pain in the chest and left arm
  • breathlessness
  • stomach discomfort
  • collapse
  • faintness or dizziness
  • pale skin, blueness of lips
  • rapid, weak or irregular pulse
  • sweating
  • gasping for air

58fdfe6e-906e-47e7-8fdb-9a0c21cd6530.content:
A heart attack is usually caused by a blockage in the heart, a blood clot. It is more common in people over 50, but people can have a heart attack at any age.


Angina is a condition linked with heart attacks. If the person has a history of angina you can help them by bringing their angina medication.
58fdfe6e-906e-47e7-8fdb-9a0c21cd6530.title: What Causes a Heart Attack?

96966a07-9992-495b-8d39-656b64d4e078.content:
What should you do?

  1. Call 999
  2. Sit them on the floor in a 'lazy W'
  3. Give them an aspirin tablet and tell them to chew it slowely
  4. Encourage them to rest and try to keep them calm
  5. Keep checking their levels of response

If they become unresponsive, prepare to treat an unresponsive casualty.
